info.title: NineML
info.subtitle: A family of Invisible XML tools

preface.title: Introduction
preface.para: NineML is a family of Invisible XML tools.

listitem.para: CoffeeGrinder implements both an Earley parser and a GLL parser. This parser forms the basis for the Invisible XML parser, but is limited to simple grammars. The JavaDoc describes the API.
CoffeeFilter is an implementation of an Invisible XML processor. This project provides the underlying Invisible XML parsing. The JavaDoc describes the API.
CoffeePot is a command line tool for parsing Invisible XML grammars and transforming inputs with them. Consult the user’s guide for more information.
CoffeeSacks provides a set of Saxon extension functions for processing Invisible XML documents from with XSLT or XQuery. Consult the user’s guide for more information.
CoffeePress is an XProc 3.0 step for XML Calabash.

chapter.title: How to…
chapter.para: The “HOWTO” repository contains examples and recipes for using NineML tools in various ways.
Feel free to contribute more, or open an issue if there’s an approach you’d like to see documented.
